lines.content: # Introducing Pixel -- your new chatbot to manage tasks
> ‚ÄúSometimes it is the people no one can imagine anything of who do the things no one can imagine.‚Äù
This is a greenfield Java project for the NUS Computer Science module CS2103 Software Engineering.
## Pixel frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do.
* You just need to follow the prompts and type down the instructions
### All you need to do is,
4. let it manage your tasks for you üòâ
- [x] Marking tasks as done/ unmark tasks
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
If you Java programmer, you can use it to practice Java too. Here's the main method in the class Pixel:
You can input the following commands
***date format for due has to be in <yyyy-MM-dd(SPACE)HHmm(24h)> format
list -- lists out all the tasks
mark <index of task in the list> -- to mark as done
unmark <index of task in the list> -- to mark as not done
delete <index of task in the list> -- to delete that particular task
find <query> -- Find all tasks with description containing query
end -- leaves the chatbot and closes the programme
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

D ;;; Not Done ;;; CS2103 project ;;; at ;;; school
Pixel frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do. It is a task manager chatbot that helps you keep track of your tasks through a simple to navigate interface.
Pixel will create a text file to store all your tasks on your device.
Don't worry about losing track of your tasks after closing Pixel!
Don't worry, Pixel will guide you through how to navigate the interface (trust me, it's simple)
- `event`: An event with a description of what and when it is
- `deadline`: A deadline with a description and due date
Search for tasks using the `find` command
Mark tasks as done or undone using the `mark` and `unmark` commands
##  `list` -  Lists all tasks in the database
Expected output: A list of all the tasks stored in the system
There are three task types, denoted by the first letter in the list
The `[X]` denotes tasks that have been marked as done
#### Expected outcome: A new task gets added to the list
Got it. I‚Äôve added this task:
You now have 1 tasks in your list.
The number shown may vary depending on how many tasks you already created.
#### Expected outcome: An new event gets added to the list
You now have 1 task to do.
The number shown may vary depending on how many tasks you already created.
You now have 1 task to do.
The number shown may vary depending on how many tasks you already created.
##  `mark` - Marks a specified task as done
Nice! I‚Äôve marked this task as done:
You may enter a new task or command
##  `unmark` - Unmarks the specified task to not done
OK, I‚Äôve marked this task as not done yet:
You may enter a new task or command
##  `delete` - Deletes the task with the specified index
You now have 2 tasks in the list.
You may enter a new task or command
The number shown may vary depending on how many tasks you already created.
##  `find` - Finds tasks that contain the specified text in their descriptions
#### Expected outcome: Pixel will list out all the tasks in the database whose description contains the query string
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
You may enter a new task or command
##  `bye` - Exits Pixel and terminates the programme
